answers.answer: Helloyour blood sugar level would indicate gestational diabetes.  During pregnancy blood sugar levels are ideally in the range of 70 - 120, and never above 140.You should have treatment (diet and exercise) and medications, if required to normalise your blood sugar.  This is important for your baby to stay healthy.You would also have a risk of developing diabetes later in life after pregnancy an should guard against this with maintaining normal wieght and diet and exercise.

question: I had glucose test and got sugar levels of 153 mg it this to worry can u suggest me with diet if I am a diabetic. Will this cause any effect to my baby? I am in 26th week now
title: Hi I am 25
